entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character of the story, referred to as 'Potter'. He is expressing disbelief and concern for Cedric's safety.

entities.name: cedric
entities.description: A person who is being asked by Harry if he has seen the dragons. He seems suspicious of Harry's intentions.

entities.name: malfoy
entities.description: One of Harry's enemies, mentioned as someone who might not be prepared to face the dragons.

entities.name: snape
entities.description: Another one of Harry's enemies, also mentioned as someone who might not be prepared to face the dragons.

entities.name: mad-eye moody
entities.description: A person who emerges from a nearby classroom and seems to have overheard Harry's conversation with Cedric.

relationships.description: Harry is talking to Cedric about the fairness of their situation and whether they are on an even footing.
Mad-Eye Moody emerges from a nearby classroom and calls Harry over, suggesting that he may have overheard their conversation with Cedric.
